page.title: 08THE SHOPS IN PORLOCK
page.content: Porlock in the past was much more important as a shopping centre for local people and many Exmoor villagers and farmers.Many stores remained in the hands of the same family for many generations.100 years ago Porlock had at least 3 Ironmongers who supplied the village with every day things, shovels,nails,oil and lamps.There were 2 bakeries,a gents' outfitters,ladies dress shop,chemist, dairy and{Parlour shops}selling chocolate and tobacco.Today there are a surprising number of shops for a village.With the introduction of the motor car people shop in towns so Porlock shops have adapted to the immediate needs of the village and tourists.There are a large number of gift and grocery stores and shops catering for country pursuits.
